item.title: Pruning Required for Roseberry Place Planting Following Cladding Works, 4th September
item.description:
The plants outside Roseberry Place buildings need pruning. Recent cladding works meant scaffolding blocked light and access, leaving some plants damaged and weakened. Pruning will help them recover and restore the landscaped areas.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Roseberry Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bus stop M on great Central Street next to bin, 4th September
item.description:
3 first mile bags and 4 other general waste bags with cardboard and litter on pavement of great Central Street next to bin near bus stop M need to clear out as it causing nuisance and hazard from Long time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Melcombe Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous sunken pavement., 4th September
item.description:
Pavement sunken from the bus stop to Pentonvile Road due to coaches from the Doubletree hotel parking on the pavement regularly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12-20, Baron Street, Barnsbury, London

item.title: Temporary traffic lights that defy common sense, 4th September
item.description:
This is for Thameswater work permit ID MU034LORDSHIPLANE2-03. Works are ongoing - but NO LANES are closed or appear to need closing - but still Thameswater puts up these irrational temporary lights?? They have been there for some days now, causing unnecessary traffic back log north/southbound. Please can Thames Water remove these unnecessary temporary lights - which hinder the lives and commute of road users.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 391, Upland Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
